name: Ibis Singapore on Bencoolen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in many hotels in Singapore but we do not think this hotel is very good value. It has quite small rooms and no bar fridge. The TV programs are sparse so you have to go to the bar to watch any good sports. If you drink at the bar better leave your credit card as drinks are not cheap. Beware of the ++ system, breakfast is $X then +10% and then another 7% of the total. ie, 100 +10% = 110 +7% = 117.70. So a $100 bill becomes $117.70
reviews.title: Ibis Hotel on Bencoolen, Singapore.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Ibis on Bencoolen for two nights. Rooms small but comfortable with free wifi and coffee/tea making facilities. Nice and quiet, no noise from neighbours or road. Hotel centrally located between two MRT stations on different lines so getting about is a cinch. They had a S$1 breakfast deal on the Accor website which made it a very good deal although breakfast itself I would only rate as average. The Hotel restaurant on the other hand had very good food at a reasonable price. There 3/4/5 combos offer new visitors a chance to sample some of Singapore's excellent food. Will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good Hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed at Ibis on Bencoolen for 1 night however enough for me to say it is a basic hotel which offers clean, practical and free wifi which was good for my stay. Its location sitauted in the Bugis area makes it attrative for people who love to shop at Bugis village and has bugis markets also good bargains there. I booked via Asiarooms.com and prepaid my accommodation before my arrival.
reviews.title: Excellent business hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: As our tripadvisor viewers mention all correct and accurate. If you are just looking for a place to sleep and don't really stay in rooms than this is the place. Food eatery is everywhere so many to choose from - just a matter of deciding what you want and just ask the concierge to locate in usually only 5 minutes away thats the cool thing about its location...just cannot beat it. Keep up the good work Ibis Singapore!
reviews.title: Basically ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: This was a basic hotel, the standard I have come to expect of IBIS. The location was good, and there was not much of a wait for taxis in the morning. This is a problem at other hotels I have stayed at in Singapore.
reviews.title: Comfortable basic Ibis hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast was good, however the coffees from the espresso machine were not. I susopect they use some sort of UHT milk, which leaves a funny taste.
reviews.title: Average Hotel but will Stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was no light inside the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great location
Good value & location and friendly staff
reviews.text: As with all IBIS hotels I have stayed in, the beds are FIRM.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: As you know, finding cheap and chic hotel in Singapore is as hard as in Hong Kong. iBis on Bencoolen is one of the perfect choice.
reviews.title: Such a good place to stay if you concern for budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is not far from MTR station, 5 mins walk. It is also easy to reach from airport.
reviews.title: Worth every penny..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is small but clean. Not too tight, but in nice condition.
reviews.title: A Down to Earth Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: 7-eleven is in the same building of the hotel, and behind the hotel you can enjoy shopping street, night market, famous temple, .. all in walking distances. Similarly to food which is easy to find around.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Service staffs were friendly during my stays of nearly a week. They were willing to help in everything. Taxis are available from the hotel lobby, and the rate is not that expensive, acceptable.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
So far so good
reviews.text: The hotel location is quite convenient and the room is neat and tidy. However, the air-conditioning is a bit cold even the temperature is turned to a room temperature level.

reviews.title: Another Good Ibis experience
reviews.text: The room size is good for 1-2 person(s). Wondering if there is room available for family with 3-4 person(s).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I also like the idea of not changing the bed sheet and bath towel, I think this is a good practice for the industry to follow.
reviews.title: Very good location, good neighborhood, value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this Ibis on a numer of occasions while visiting Singapore on business. It is an excellent value for money hotel in a good location. The rooms are clean, there's free internet access and the food is well priced if you want to eat at the hotel. The room would benefit from having a small fridge to store cold drinks in. These seem to have been removed now.
reviews.title: Very good hotel and situation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some sites class this as a budget hotel, I've stayed in 5 star hotels that aren't as good as this.
reviews.title: Could have been any where

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel in December for four nights. The location is quite convenient and the room was clean. Other than that, we were quite disappointed.
reviews.title: Need better trained staff and much better food
Great place to stay
reviews.text: We arrived late at night. In spite of making the reservation two months before, we were told that there were no nonsmoking rooms available and if we wanted, we could change rooms the following day. Since our time was pretty tight, the last thing we wanted to do was to unpack and pack again for the move, so we stayed on the smoking floor which left us with a bad impression of the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The stay did not improve much afterwards. The hotel staff was of no help when you needed any information other than how to get to all the well-known touristy places (Orchid Road, Little India, etc.) I wanted to visit the nature reserve and asked at least five people but none seemed to know where it was and how to get there. That was just one example.
reviews.title: Highly reommend this hotel in Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night on 23rd December for a stopover in Singapore. From the word go we were impressed by the Ibis. Comfortable bed, tea and coffee making facilities, shower. The accommodation is what you would expect from an Ibis hotel, but the attitude and helpfulness of the staff was what really impressed us.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations, highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Singapore in the morning but were able to check in right away as there was a room available, which was a real bonus (we had anticipated waiting around or leaving our bags whilst awaiting our check-in time). There are always plenty of staff in the foyer to attend to your needs and answer any questions about the hotel or transport, sightseeing etc. We were even able to use their computer to print our boarding passes for our ongoing flight.
reviews.title: Great location, value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location was great if you want to explore a bit more than just Clarke Quay. Most attractions are within walking distance. We walked to Clarke Quay to go on a bumboat tour. Being close to Little India we walked to the Banana Leaf restaurant at night and enjoyed a delicious meal. We felt this location meant we were able to see a bit more of Singapore than just the traditional tourist part.
reviews.title: Very small rooms, horrrible beds, good location
Weighing Scale & Face Towels
reviews.text: We had pre-booked breakfast at the Ibis (although I believe the rate is the same whether you pre-book or pay on the day). I would highly recommend having breakfast here. They had a lot to offer, for all tastes and nationalities' preferences. It was fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was fairly basic but spacious enough (for a city location) and clean and tidy. I would definitely stay here again if visiting Singapore.
reviews.title: great new hotel at very great location
Hotel with good location but to expensive
reviews.text: This hotel has a good location and if wanted many sights can be visited from here walking. At the front desk there should be more people as it is a very busy hotel. More attention should be given to the cleaning staff as the process is very slow, one evening still at 18.00 hours they were cleaning rooms. I desisted having mine cleaned that day.The breakfast buffet is good but is lacking an egg station. Altough of good quality what is offered is too expensive.

reviews.title: New Year's Eve Holiday
reviews.text: We took 4 rooms and stayed for 4 nights, during checks in, the hotel reception staff kindly showed us the room, smoking/non smoking floor, with connecting door, and they offered to clean the room first from cigarettes scent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the lobby, they provides brochures/leaflets/map of Singapore's which is very useful if we want to know Singapore's interesting places, also they provide bus route to Orchard Road, and other places. We had to carry the luggages by ourself with a trolley provided, that's the compensation for the hotel stars.
reviews.title: Everything you want and need, except for the food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room itself is very clean, not spacious, but we can fit large luggages under the bed, or the table beside the window, cigarettes scent not exist anymore cause they already did clean it as promised. Deposit box, towels, amenities, and coffee/tea provided, but the refrigerator is too small and not cold enough. The room is silent enough, good for sleep especially we travelled with a baby. The room window is only protected with one layer of curtain, so in the broad daylight it would be so shiny, again thats the compensation of the hotel star's.
reviews.title: Clean & convenient located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel's restaurant serve only limited choice of food, but many places to eat nearby in a walking distance. Besides, we only use the hotel for rest/sleep, most of the time we went city tours. Overall we enjoyed our stay, and would like to come again sometime...
reviews.title: Could not be more compact

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Ibis hotel for three nights. We had breakfast and a city tour included, which made it quite inexpensive. Breakfast had a large variety of food and was tasty and the city tour with the "Hop On, Hop Off" company helped us get our bearings in Singapore. The room was compact, but had everything we needed- tea and coffee making facilities, hairdryer, aircon and tv. Free Internet in the lobby was also good as we were travelling without a laptop. I'd recommend the Ibis for other travellers looking for clean and convenient accommodation.
reviews.title: Small but functional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Ibis on Bencoolen was great and the customer service excellent. The rooms are small (the fridge is the smallest I have ever seen) however there is so much to see in Singapore the time spent in our room was minimal. The beds are comfy, breakfast nice and the staff always willing to help.
reviews.title: GOOD LOCATION - GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE

description: Ideal hotel location in Singapore next to Singapore shopping & business centers. FREE Wi-Fi access, international adaptors and USB chargers, the ibis room has got everything you need for a high quality budget hotel in Singapore.Complimentary shuttle to Resort World Sentosa Singapore opposite the Hotel and near Bugis MRT station. Enjoy great deals by booking online our budget bed and breakfast promotion. TASTE Restaurant serves breakfast and local Singapore dishes.Best Economy Hotel in Asia Pacific by TTG in 2009-12 and Certificate of Excellence by Tripadvisor in 2012-13.
